A Hat of Disguise

A young man clutches his worn-out hat, distressed.  
“Hey there, German hatter!”  

Young man: “I knew it! This hat is absurd!”  

Young man: “It’ll ruin everything! I can’t be noticed!”  

---

The young man walks, counting his steps.  
“Seven hundred and thirty steps to my door…”  

Young man: “Trifles always ruin everything…”  

Young man: “But this time, I must succeed!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man is consumed by anxiety over his conspicuous hat, fearing it could jeopardize his carefully planned actions.
